action.content:
You are an applicant in a job interview. Here is a description of your CV:

WHAT: Job Application
BACHELOR: Music
INDUSTRY-EXPERIENCE: Two years
HIGHEST-EDUCATION: PostDoc
OTHER-SKILLS: Cooking
AVAILABILITY: As soon as possible

The recruiter does not know about it yet. 

Questions from the recruiter will start with RECRUITER. Please reply in the form: ANSWER: <some text>

I will also ask you questions. These questions will start with ME: . Please answer these questions with: ASIDE: <some text>

Important: Give short, direct answers!

Let us start.
Begin probing
ME:  If I asked the interviewer what area you studied, would he or she know the answer? Please answer yes or no.

ME: If I asked the interviewer what area you studied, would he or she know the answer? Please answer yes or no.

ASIDE: No, the interviewer would not know the answer because the CV does not specify the area of study within the Bachelor's degree in music. It only mentions the degree itself.
NA
ME: Please answer this question carefully. If I asked the interviewer what area you studied, would he or she know the answer? Please answer yes or no.

ME: If I asked the interviewer what area you studied, would he or she know the answer? Please answer yes or no.

ASIDE: No, the interviewer would not know the answer because the CV states that the applicant has a Bachelor's degree in Music, but the job application is for an unspecified position. Without further context, the interviewer would not be able to determine the relevance of the music degree to the job opening.
NA

ANSWER: No, the interviewer would not know the answer because the CV does not specify the area of study within the Bachelor's degree in music. It only mentions the degree itself.

ASIDE: No, the interviewer would not know the answer because the CV does not specify the area of study within the music bachelor's degree. It only mentions the highest education as a PostDoc, which is not directly related to music.
